programme.desc: Steve returns home to the Atlantic waters of the British Isles as he considers the question of what humanity can do to ensure the enduring future of whales, which have already survived so much.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Face a life-and-death struggle with vet Bec, who gives a koala joey mouth-to-mouth, and see vet Meaghan test her microsurgical skills on a baby fruit bats teeny toes. Catch a bath-averse python and tag along as rescuer Jo nabs a trapped barn owl.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Watch senior vet Tim tutor new recruit Phil through an injured koala checkup, and track the teams solutions for animals plagued by the summer heat. Celebrate as vet Karina solves a puzzling frog case and releases an old friend whos ready to fly.

programme.title: Pride Rules
programme.desc: Contend with the challenges of the rainy season, which turns everything green and spoils the lions camouflage.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Novice fliers tackle their first ascents, earth-bound creatures soar uniquely and sky masters race with speed, power and agility.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Each species evolves unique tools to outpace rivals in the eat-or-be-eaten game, taking to the skies is the ultimate advantage.

programme.title: Age of Big Cats
programme.desc: Saber-tooths rule the Pleistocene Era but the arrival of the new cats, early snow leopards, cheetahs and jaguars, mark a turning point in the evolutionary track.

programme.title: The Predators Playbook
programme.desc: An exploration of the unique features that allow predators to survive in often hostile environments,. such as speed and agility to undetectable camouflage.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough charts the story of animals who defy gravity, starting with the planets first flyers: the insect.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: After meeting some critters who glide through life in Borneo, Sir David Attenborough decides to turn back the clock.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: In the final episode in the series, Sir David Attenborough turns his attention to the creatures that dominate our skies today.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas
programme.desc: From the blond manes of golden snub-nose monkeys, to the flamingos pink feathers, get a front-row seat to natures most spectacular fashion show.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas
programme.desc: For certain alphas - from gorillas and moose to pelicans and sharks - bigger is definitely better.

programme.title: Super Shark Highway
programme.desc: Two teams of researchers investigate the migration patterns of the oceans largest and deadliest sharks. They follow their underwater routes and show their hunting behaviours, and social hierarchies.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Its a critical time for two black rhinos in Zambia. Four year old female Apson and fourteen year old bull Kango are at the core of a complex relocation mission thats part of a grand plan to save a species.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Deep in Kafue National Park, the largest and wildest protected area in Zambia, a team of biologists and vets from the Zambian Carnivore Programme (ZCP) races against time to save and protect Africas apex predators.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas
programme.desc: From the blond manes of golden snub-nose monkeys, to the flamingos pink feathers, get a front-row seat to natures most spectacular fashion show.

programme.title: Battle of the Alphas
programme.desc: For certain alphas - from gorillas and moose to pelicans and sharks - bigger is definitely better.

programme.title: Super Shark Highway
programme.desc: Two teams of researchers investigate the migration patterns of the oceans largest and deadliest sharks. They follow their underwater routes and show their hunting behaviours, and social hierarchies.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A look at the lives of monkeys, chimps, orangutans, and apes living at the worlds biggest sanctuary, the 65-acre Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Wareham, Dorset.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A look at the lives of monkeys, chimps, orangutans, and apes living at the worlds biggest sanctuary, the 65-acre Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Wareham, Dorset.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: The first sense to evolve in the first animals was chemoreception. It means being able to detect chemicals in the animals environment. This helps animals find prey and mates, and to sense predators from a distance.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: The sense of touch is useful to feel physical forces such as bites, changes in temperature and texture. Some animals have become extra sensitive to feel very faint vibrations, which give them a lot of information about their environment.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Seeing the world is one of the most amazing animal adaptations. Different types of eyes give animals different types of vision, and in some cases they can be extraordinary.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Sound waves are produced by movement. Animals have evolved organs to detect those sound waves in the air or water to perceive movements in their environment. This can be used to find prey, predators, and mates. These are some of the animals that have mastered the sense of hearing.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Some animals have senses that humans cant even conceive. With those powers they can do marvellous things.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Humans have sharp senses, which we use explore our environment. Vibrations in the air, light, and chemicals in our food and in the air give us the information we need to survive. But some animals have taken those senses and, through evolution, turned them into marvels of biological engineering.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: The Lilayi Elephant Nursery near Lusaka in Zambia is home to four orphan elephants. The two oldest have been there since they were just a few months old. These boisterous babies are out-growing the nursery and it is time to move to big school.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Kinda baboons have turned their backs on the aggressive displays of dominance usually associated with these large monkeys and lead altogether more peaceful lives.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Madonna is the first Kinda baboon ever to be studied from birth to adulthood and now, critically, she is looking for a mate. Only recently identified as a species in their own right, Kinda baboons are little known and little understood.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Across Africa 97 black rhinos have been killed for their horns. In 1997 the species was declared officially extinct in Zambia, but now, thanks to an ambitious reintroduction plan, they are back.

programme.title: Into the Wild India
programme.desc: The day-to-day lives and challenges of some of Indias most iconic species and creatures.

programme.title: Into the Wild India
programme.desc: One of the most iconic animals on Earth stalks the jungles of India: the Bengal Tiger. Over the course of a single day, we follow the fortunes of one mother and her three young cubs. She must provide enough food for her family to stay alive.

programme.title: Into the Wild India
programme.desc: A young lion cub must survive as his family is torn apart and two adolescent leopard cubs must fend for themselves after they are abandoned. Plus, a young adult blackbuck must risk life and limb as he tries to secure his first mating.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: Nearly every species on Earth must find a mate and while some become partners for life, for others its just a fleeting moment.

programme.title: Airborne
programme.desc: All airborne creatures embark on remarkable journeys through the air, some routes are short and others across hundreds of miles.

programme.title: Age of Big Cats
programme.desc: The era of the saber-tooth is over and the biggest big cats ever, the lion and the tiger, become the kings of their respective habitats.

programme.title: Age of Big Cats
programme.desc: Changes the planet has undergone affects big cats, from the almost complete disappearance of American wildlife to the rise of man, and threatens their survival.

programme.desc: A look at the lives of monkeys, chimps, orangutans, and apes living at the worlds biggest sanctuary, the 65-acre Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Wareham, Dorset.

programme.desc: Get acquainted with an array of ocean oddballs and learn how billions of years worth of changes, from ice ages to asteroid strikes, have shaped their looks and skills. Meet blind worms who fish, walking sharks, tree-climbing crabs, and much more.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through the Britain of his youth from Londons Docklands and East End to the city within a city, the Barbican.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his railway exploration of the post-war Britain of his youth on a journey from London to Cambridge.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are delighted when they uncover some old toys, and seize the opportunity to release their inner-children.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank revisit New England and hope to discover rusty gold that may have eluded them the first time through.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team head for restoration in their Bedford Rascal Campervan. They also purchase a true British classic - a TR6 - which is almost too good to touch!

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien are back, travelling Britain seeking items to fix up and flog on. They restore eight items including a pine blanket chest, a pair of battlefield telephones, and some gothic church windows.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien go military: Simon converts tank parts to garden furniture whilst Henry takes his life in his hands with a motorised skateboard.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: A day out on the river leads to epic complications for the Meldrews, Mrs Warboys, and Nick Swainey when they find themselves marooned in the middle of Norfolks answer to the Sargasso Sea.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrews are back from holiday and find that Patrick and Pippa are trying to sell up to a man whos very interested in diving goggles. Margaret can take no more of their erratic existence and decides to embark on a reckless adventure that could change both her own and Victors life for ever.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Victors conjuring group runs into trouble when a magic trick goes horribly wrong.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: From a very young age, Fred had a passion for steam-powered engines and machinery and he spent a large part of his life studying their construction and history.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Freds fascination with mining led him not just to dig his own coal mine in his back garden, but was also used to make viewers aware of the skills of miners and engineers, and the dangers and hardships faced by miners throughout history.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Fred shares his fascination with the canals, bridges and tunnels that he grew up around and the people that made them.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Fred served his apprenticeship as a joiner and always showed a great appreciation for the skills of the men who built Britains great castles, palaces and country houses.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred and his team are in the mountains of Snowdonia on the final stage of their journey, and must get through Llanberis Pass. At the Welsh Slate Museum, Fred and Alf take a look in the workshop where machinery is driven by a line shaft an eighth of a mile long.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred completes his journey by visiting the Welsh Slate Museum, then the worlds first boat lift in Cheshire before returning home to Bolton. He makes one final trip down to London to collect his MBE from the Queen.

programme.desc: Derek travels to the Yorkshire coast to pick up a 1963 Austin J2 Paralanian campervan, described as the Rolls Royce of campervans.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves on his way to Grimsby to pick up an iconic 80s fast Ford, the Mk1 Fiesta XR2.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gets a tour of Hadlow Castle in Kent when he collects an immaculate Citroen that was once used by the Gestapo in occupied France, Dave considers spending his own money on a hay cart, and Paul unearths a remarkably rust-free 1970s Alfa GTV.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The Mathewson family continue their pursuit of classic cars. In the home counties, Derek picks up two expertly crafted replicas of the batmobile. Meanwhile, Dave struggles to contain his enthusiasm for a Second World War Ford jeep.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul picks up a stunning 1961 Vauxhall Cresta, Dave drools over a Ford Sierra Sapphire Cosworth, and Derek refuses a test drive in the worlds smallest production car, the 3.5 horsepower Peel P50.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek inspects a collection of old police cars that includes a Rover P6 complete with radio, sirens and V8 engine. Meanwhile, Paul tries to figure out who will buy an old 1975 Range Rover that has been converted into a fire engine.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail exploration of the east of England, beginning with the seafront at Felixstowe, where in January 1953, the town was engulfed in the worst flooding to hit England in the 20th century.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo completes his railway journey through the east of England during the post-war period. At RAF Lakenheath, he discovers a slice of America dropped into the British countryside, watching the US Air Forces Strike Eagles.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the post-war Britain of his youth in a journey from the Midlands to the West Country. Beginning in Derbys railway works, Michael hears how the Victorian sheds now house some of the most modern assembly lines in Britain.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Coventry, Michael recalls the destruction by the German Luftwaffe of the citys gothic cathedral in November 1940. Heading south to Royal Leamington Spa, Michael visits the Guide Dogs for the Blind National Centre, established in the town in 1941.

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and his guide dog, Major, are off to Blairgowrie and Rattray in Perthshire. He asks those who live in the town how they feel about the place and what its future might hold.

programme.title: My Kind of Town
programme.desc: Ian Hamilton and guide dog Major are off to Annan in Dumfries and Galloway. With its important industrial history, including boat building, fishing and even nuclear power, how is Annan adapting to the modern world?

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Force 11 storms are expected but one young skipper has a point to prove to his dad.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Father and son team Charlie and Charles McBride have a disastrous week on their boat the Arcane when they lose their best fishing net, their boat loses power and they are driven into port. With massive debts, they have no choice but to attempt to retrieve the net from the bottom of the North Sea. Also, on the Amity, Jimmy Buchan has money worries too as boat maintenance sets him back £70,000.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Chaz Bruce, who is only 23, and his crew on the New Dawn find a rope wrapped around the boats propeller, but skipper Chaz is relentless to put into port, even with a storm brewing. With his fish-hold still empty, Chaz needs to prove himself amongst the more experienced skippers.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Theres an unlikely arrival at the North Yorkshire car auction - an Argentinian Army Mercedes G wagon that saw action in the Falklands War.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has three scooters to collect, while also finding room for a Daimler and a teardrop caravan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team head for restoration in their Bedford Rascal Campervan. They also purchase a true British classic - a TR6 - which is almost too good to touch!

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will find an old Alfa 155 in a barn, which is entirely original. The price seems good too, but on taking a second look, the undercarriage of the vehicle appears to be in a sorry state.

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: David Attenborough has a passion for birds eggs. These remarkable structures nurture new life, protecting it from the outside world at the same time as allowing it to breathe. They are strong enough to withstand the full weight of an incubating parent and weak enough to allow a chick to break free.

programme.title: Attenboroughs Birds of Paradise
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the mystery and scientific revelation surrounding the elusive birds.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Series celebrating our planet in all its glory. This episode journeys across the world, following the influence of the sun and discovering how its seasonal journey affects the lives of all who live on earth. As spring arrives in the Arctic, a mother polar bear emerges from her den with two tiny cubs. At the other end of the planet, winter arrives and Emperor penguins are plunged into darkness for four months.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Taking an epic journey following the descent of the planets mightiest rivers from their mountain sources to the sea. Breathtaking river scenery is revealed by a revolutionary helicopter camera mount - from the worlds highest and broadest waterfalls to the awe-inspiring spectacle of the 10,000-strong flocks of greater snow geese in flight.

programme.title: Simon Reeves South America
programme.desc: Simon Reeve journeys through the remote and little-visited northeast of the continent, from the tabletop mountain Mount Roraima in Venezuela through Guyana, Suriname, and French Guiana.

programme.title: Robson Green: Worlds Most Amazing Walks
programme.desc: In the first episode, Robson Green sets out on one of the most iconic walks in the UK, the Hadrians Wall path.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will find an old Alfa 155 in a barn, which is entirely original. The price seems good too, but on taking a second look, the undercarriage of the vehicle appears to be in a sorry state.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team head for restoration in their Bedford Rascal Campervan. They also purchase a true British classic - a TR6 - which is almost too good to touch!

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A 1969 Morris Mini Cooper MkII is totally restored by specialists. They give it the full works, which means only one thing... any chance of profit heads towards an open window.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restoring Classics team set out on a Pre-War challenge with a 1939 three wheeled Morgan F4 - and aptly named Russ Storer from MG Mecca is still keen to take it on.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Dhanak
programme.desc: Rainbow is an uplifting, enchanting, magical fable set in Rajasthan that reinforces the belief that life is beautiful. The story revolves around the wonderful relationship between a 10 year old girl Pari and Chotu, her 8-year old brother.

programme.title: Main Tujhpe Qurbaan
programme.desc: Two young students meet in college, develop a friendship, and gradually fall in love, but they find themselves forced to elope when the girls father opposes their romance.

programme.title: Khullam Khulla Pyaar Karen
programme.desc: Two crime bosses are told by their Supreme Leader to reconcile, by marrying their children to each other. Reluctantly Vardhaman send his son Vicky to meet Priti, Damanias daughter. On the way, Vicky picks up Raja, who is a small time crook with no money. Drunken Vicky drives the car into a river, and Raja is rescued and taken to Pritis father mistaken for Vicky. Raja decides to take advantage of the situation.

programme.title: Dishoom
programme.desc: Two cops, Kabir and Junaid, go on a mission to rescue Viraj, a leading cricketer, who has been kidnapped by Wagah, a bookie, and his associate.

programme.title: Chandni Chowk to China
programme.desc: Sidhu is on the lowest rung of society, cutting vegetables in a roadside stall. He longs to escape his existence and seeks a better future through fortune tellers and astrologers, never taking control of his own existence. Then, two strangers from China arrive and take him to China, claiming him to be a reincarnation of a war hero in the past.

programme.title: Kal Ho Naa Ho
programme.desc: Student Naina is good friends with her classmate, skirt-chaser Rohit. Her home life is rife with family tensions as her widowed mums restaurant runs into difficulties. When charismatic Aman moves into the neighbourhood, he changes everyones lives, bringing a breath of fresh air, and although he loses his heart to Naina, Aman has a secret that prevents him from marrying her.

programme.title: Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge
programme.desc: A man struggles to win over members of his girlfriends family, who all want her to marry someone else.

programme.desc: A woman faces pregnancy dilemmas when she discovers she is pregnant by two different men.
